messages: 77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (12:06): hello, is there any possibility to add Layout to groupbox?
7c8fd3e81e6b000427aa2579afeffab8 (12:06): yup
7c8fd3e81e6b000427aa2579afeffab8 (12:07): yacek, its the same as in QFrame, QWidget, yada yada
77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (12:07): when I create some layout with groupbox as a parent, this layout is outside the groupbox
7c8fd3e81e6b000427aa2579afeffab8 (12:08): odd, well im out, sleep time
77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (12:12): so waht should I do if I want to add layout inside groupbox
7c8fd3e81e6b000427aa2579afeffab8 (12:14): http://qtnode.net/pastebin show us your code
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (12:16): 'yacek' pasted "layouts": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/470

77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (12:17): qprogressbar shows propertly because it is not in layout, it is a single object inside groupbox. But anything which is in layout than in groupbox, doesn't show
7c8fd3e81e6b000427aa2579afeffab8 (12:18): now all you have to do is wait for someone who actually writes their layout code, sorry i cant really help you, im a designer n00b :)
77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (12:18): thanks anyway
7c8fd3e81e6b000427aa2579afeffab8 (12:19): good night
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:26): does your window itself have a layout?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:26): ie the QDialog/QMainWindow?
77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (12:27): yes, I have qdialog and mainLayout which stores everyhthing
77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (12:31): please tell me what is the main idea of putting layouts inside groupbox,  how is it generally done?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:43): yacek: myLayout = new QVBoxLayout(myGroupBox);
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:44): QVBoxLayout, or whatever layout you want
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:44): then you just do: myLayout->addWidget(whatever)
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:44): that's how it's done
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (12:44): nuge: Error: "layouts" is not a valid command.
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (12:44): nuge: No keys matched that query.
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (12:44): nuge: [layout] http://qtnode.net/wiki/Layouts
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:45): hmm. that article doesn't help i guess
77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (12:45): I think that myLayout->addWidget() already adds widget to children list
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:45): yes you are right
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:45): they get reparented
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:49): Hi. Any expert here who has / uses QCA and may assist me on getting it compiled and installed properly?
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:49): I use QT 3.3 on Linux and I am trying to compile Psi (IM client).
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:50): Building of Psi fails at linking stage due to lots of unresolved symbols related to QCA.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:51): According to the (short) QCA doc I was first putting libqca-tls.so into the QT plugins directory - no effect.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:52): Then I was putting it into the /usr/lib/ directory and editing the Makefile of Psi, adding "-lqca-tls" to LIBS - no effect.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:53): Eventually I have found out that the missing symbols may actually not be inside my libqca-tls.so.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:54): For instance, one undefined reference is about "QCA::isSupported(int)".
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:54): what is qca really?
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:54): There is no public symbol like "isSupported" in my libqca-tls.so, though it's over 1 MB in size.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:55): chakie_work: QT Cryptographic Architecture
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:55): ah
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:56): maybe the "tls" lib is just one plugin for qca?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:56): ie there could be a libqca-ssl.so or similar?
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:56): The isSupported() function is just defined in qca.h but libqca-tls.so doesn't contain it.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:57): Well, the docs state it's supposed to be named 'libqca". When I make it it's always named "libqca-tls". But that doesn't seem to be the problem.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:57): The problem seems to be that libqca-tls.so doesn't contain the symbols it's (likely) supposed to do.
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:58): or then QCA::isSupported(int) is obsolete?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:58): or too new?
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:58): It's just a simple example. There are nearly a hundred of undefined references like that.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:58): To alls orts of QCA-related functions.
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:59): my take is that there is some general lib missing
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (12:59): There is a line in qca.h: "QCA_EXPORT bool isSupported(int capabilities)".
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (13:00): However, the macro "QCA_EXPORT" is an empty macro.
77f22a3a6bad707d556f2e73c4280563 (13:00): hey, here is the way to add qgroupbox to qlayout: myLayout = new QVBoxLayout(myGroupBox); but what if I want to add some layout inside qgroupbox?
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (13:00): And besides this single (empty) definition in the header it isn't used anywhere else in the QCA source dir.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (13:01): Anywhere here who has libqca-tls.so installed as well and can check whether it contains symbols like "isSupported"?
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (13:03): http://delta.affinix.com/qca/ that is, btw.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (13:16): All right. Got a binary package of libqca and there the missing symbols seem to be compiled in, indeed.
84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (13:16): So I likely got a nonfunctional source package by the above link.

84a26c4612a7f9958174ee6552625282 (13:17): The funny thing is: the lib file without the needed symbols is (stripped) ~1.2 MB in size while the apparently correct file with the symbsol is just ~90 KB in size...!
